title: Off The Grid: Inside Neill Blomkamp's Game World

rawLines.text: you're now plugged in to the deli
[Music]
podcast hello everyone and welcome to
another episode of the delphy podcast I
am delighted today to be joined by one
of the co-founders and the creative lead
of Godzilla games uh who have just
dropped you know Off the Grid the big
AAA Battle Royale that I uh won't stop
banging on about Neil it's a pleasure to
have you here yeah thanks for having me
man perhaps for those that might not be

could kick us off with a bit of a

introduction on uh the projects that

I have I've directed a few science

has always made me interested in gaming
so I went from uh visual effects to

videos and then my goal was always films

the I was going to direct a liveaction

ended up making District 9 and then I

and I'm about to do a new science

you know the world of the world of games

Grid awesome yeah I must admit that one

what was what was that journey into it

and I think I come at this project or
this this industry from a very different

because for me the the most interesting

realtime Graphics really that's that's

before before unreal was as uh sort of

sequences in a film called demonic using
using unity and so there was there was a
real interest for me in the idea of
creating a world that people could

super interesting to me and the ability
to move around in 3D and have sound
change and your whole perspective you

um actually Richard Morgan contacted me

pretty intense very

you have to be able to bring them back

the near satirical future where people

not
